intro: Lastrea macgregorii, commonly known as the MacGregor's lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and low rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
